entry.dcterms:title: Public Opinion About the Traffic Regulations of the District of Inner Franzstadt in Budapest 2001
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E47: Public Opinion About the Traffic Regulations of the District of Inner Franzstadt in Budapest 2001. data sheet. Version: 2007-02-12
entry.dcterms:creator: Józan, Anna
entry.dcterms:contributor: Budapest District 9 Ferencváros Self-government Mayors Office
entry.dcterms:subject: 2004-02-00: the labels of the data file are corrected and complemented
entry.dcterms:description: opinions about the changes in the traffic regulations of inner Franzstadt in Budapest (speed limit, Ráday street bcoming a pedestrian street, new parkig order), preferences for bus traffic
entry.dcterms:subject: land use planning
political institutions, public administration
transport, travel (and mobility)
person
survey data
cross-section

The persons to be included in the sample were selected with a two-dimensional quota-based method from among the inhabitants of flats with telephones. The interviewer had to interview the youngest person from the family members over 18 years, in a way that the sample would contain an equal number of men and women in the end. The sample consists of two subsamples: one of them includes 303 residents from Ráday street, the other contains 411 residents from inner Franzstadt, but not from Ráday street.
Telephone interview based on questionnaire.
A
